title: Marc's Portfolio
CFGS_more: (Superior Grade in Spain), like NVQ 4 in UK or Junior College in the US.
home_aboutMe: Student of Computer Engineering at Universitat Oberta de Catalunya. Very motivated to learn and grow professionally.
aboutMe_text1:
I'm Marc Boakye, Full Stack Developer since I studied and . I did a 3x2, that means that in three years I obtained both degrees.
At the present, I'm studying Computer Engineering at , I chose the Software Engineering branch. At the end of September I will start my last year, I have one subject left and the Bachelor’s Thesis. The end is close!
aboutMe_text2: This last semester has been the one where I have gotten my best grades:
aboutMe_text3: Technologies that I used during this time:
portfolio_text1: In this page you will find the projects I did (personal projects, academics or in group). You can also find them in my GitHub:
portfolio_buttonGroup_ariaLabel: Button group with a nested menu
aboutPage_text1: This page is built with Vite and React (JS). I also used HTML and CSS.
aboutPage_text2: For the design I used the Material Design (<1>MUI in React) components, and I also took ideas from the following portfolios:
aboutPage_text3: I have been able to develop all the ideas that I had.
aboutPage_text4: In this repository you will find the portfolio's source code:
aboutPage_text5: I really wanted to use React, I knew this framework because it is one of the most popular in Frontend, but I never used it. For this reason, I watched a <1>Udemy course</1> (it's in Spanish) that helped me to understand the basics of this framework.
aboutPage_text6: On the other hand, I used Vite to reduce wait times while developing, since you can see the changes after saving. Furthermore, using the host option helped me to test the website on different devices.
aboutPage_text7: To resolve the doubts and problems that I had, I searched on Google and StackOverflow.

groupProjects.name: EatNow
groupProjects.description: Final project of the .NET Bootcamp, it's an application to make reservations and manage restaurants.

groupProjects.name: ProyectoF
groupProjects.description: Final project of <Tooltip title='{{DAW_name}} {{CFGS_more}}' text='WAD'>WAD</Tooltip>, it's an application to view events and tickets purchased in the Android app.
groupProjects.moreInfo: My two schoolmates developed the Android app, I developed the website and the backend, which provided the data to the app and the website.

groupProjects.name: Mensakas
groupProjects.description: Project that I did in <Tooltip title='{{DAW_name}} {{CFGS_more}}' text='WAD'>WAD</Tooltip>, it's an application to manage restaurants and make orders (like Glovo).

groupProjects.description: Project that I did in <Tooltip title='{{DAW_name}} {{CFGS_more}}' text='WAD'>WAD</Tooltip>, it's an application to make questionnaries like Kahoot.

groupProjects.name: Fallout Terminal
groupProjects.description: Project that I did in <Tooltip title='{{DAW_name}} {{CFGS_more}}' text='WAD'>WAD</Tooltip>, it's a game that looks like the terminal from the game Fallout.

groupProjects.description: Final project of <Tooltip title='{{DAM_name}} {{CFGS_more}}' text='CPAD'>CPAD</Tooltip>, it's an application similar to Moodle but in Android.

groupProjects.name: Scrum manager

groupProjects.name: Car configurator
groupProjects.description: Project that I did in <Tooltip title='{{DAM_name}} {{CFGS_more}}' text='CPAD'>CPAD</Tooltip>, it's an application to configure a car and buy it.
groupProjects.moreInfo: It's similar to what you would do in any car brand website.
